title: How Donald Trump is rewriting US history
subhead: As the country marks its 250th anniversary this year, the American president, who returned to the White House on January 20, 2025, has worked to shape a revised historical narrative, revealing signs of megalomania.

title: Bad Bunny brings Puerto Rico's culture to Super Bowl halftime show, with a Lady Gaga surprise
AI's impact on entire sectors of the economy shakes Wall Street
Portugal: Socialist Antonio José Seguro elected president, beating far right
subhead: His opponent, André Ventura, founder and leader of the far-right Chega party, garnered more votes than in the May 2025 parliamentary elections, and has established himself as a key figure in the country's political scene.

title: French police arrest six over cryptocurrency magistrate kidnapping
subhead: The suspects were taken into custody following the discovery of the 35-year-old magistrate and her 67-year-old mother on Friday morning, found injured in a garage in the southeastern Drôme region.

title: 'The ancient city-states Thucydides describes resemble the middle powers of the 21st century'
subhead: Today's middle powers are reshaping their alliances to confront Donald Trump's United States, much as the Sicilian city-states did against imperialist Athens in the 5th century BCE, historian Robert Zaretsky argues.

title: Mayor and mother: The young women changing France's local councils
subhead: Only 41 women under the age of 30 were elected as mayors in 2020, out of France's 34,885 mayors. Here are the stories of several women who have balanced their careers, motherhood and first terms in office in a political scene often dominated by older men.

2026 Super Bowl: Bad Bunny, the anti-Trump icon made in Puerto Rico
subhead: On Sunday, in front of tens of millions of television viewers, the Puerto Rican reggaeton phenomenon will headline the Super Bowl halftime show, on the heels of winning Album of the Year at the Grammys. But, at a time when the ruthless crackdown on undocumented immigrants is raging in the US, inviting this Latin icon to one of America's major events was always bound to anger Donald Trump.

title: Epstein's correspondence reveals links to French public figures
subhead: Millions of emails released by the US Department of Justice reveal the financier's relationships, some more intense than others, with several figures from France's politics and culture.

title: 'Canada, better the 28th EU member than the 51st US state'
subhead: The Canadian prime minister has called for an alliance of middle powers to stand up to the world's great powers. This is a compelling idea, and one that Europe has been pursuing for 60 years, writes Le Monde columnist Pascal Riché.

title: 'Dependence on the US is deeply rooted in the European mindset'
